Persona: Generally, your paragraphs are too short. It's not that they have to be 200 words long, but they do have to be more substantive: they should make a claim (your key sentence) and then spend something like five sentences supporting, elaborating or defending that claim (any less and the support, elaboration or defense becomes to flimsy).  Also, specialize your paragraphs. They should be about theory OR analysis OR discussion. You make them do too many things at once, and so they suffer from what all multitaskers suffer from.  You also have some very funky formatting going on at the bottom of your first page.  I don't know what "classic innovation" means. I think you mean something like "innovation in red ocean markets , but it's not really clear. And Blue Ocean and Red Ocean are theoretical concepts that need referencing...

Friend: ok so a quick catch up on your job search. Mia from Guldsmeden received you cover letter and CV. She told me that there are couple of spelling mistakes but she loved it and find it perfect. She cant promise anything except the fact that she will make sure that your application reaches the right people.
Friend: With regards to Bella Sky. Just send an email to the guy who gave me the job there. He is really cool and he is responsible for hiring at the reception. I know that the hotel is always looking for trainees and you have the advantage that you are very young and they can shape you. I sent him the following email.


Hi Ole, 


hopefully you are doing great! 

Recently I spoke with Pierre from the reception with regards to trainee positions. In the house where I live one of the boys is looking for a trainee job as a receptionist. He is 18 years old, from Copenhagen and still going to school; therefore, he is looking for part-time job in order to learn the business. I think that Bella Sky would be a good option to provide him with a good amount of experience and a good start in the professional life.

I know him already for couple of years. He is very talkative, responsible, stable and most importantly willing to learn and work. 

In the attachment to this email you can find his CV with phone number and email address, so you can contact him in case you think it will be a good match.

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Also, specialize your paragraphs. They should be about theory OR analysis OR discussion. You make them do too many things at once, and so they suffer from what all multitaskers suffer from.  You also have some very funky formatting going on at the bottom of your first page.  I don't know what "classic innovation" means. I know him already for couple of years. He is very talkative, responsible, stable and most importantly willing to learn and work. 

In the attachment to this email you can find his CV with phone number and email address, so you can contact him in case you think it will be a good match.

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Kind regards

Nikolay

In the attachment to this email you can find his CV with phone number and email address, so you can contact him in case you think it will be a good match.

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Also, specialize your paragraphs. They should be about theory OR analysis OR discussion. You make them do too many things at once, and so they suffer from what all multitaskers suffer from. See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Persona: Generally, your paragraphs are too short. It's not that they have to be 200 words long, but they do have to be more substantive: they should make a claim (your key sentence) and then spend something like five sentences supporting, elaborating or defending that claim (any less and the support, elaboration or defense becomes to flimsy).  Also, specialize your paragraphs. They should be about theory OR analysis OR discussion. You make them do too many things at once, and so they suffer from what all multitaskers suffer from.  You also have some very funky formatting going on at the bottom of your first page.  I don't know what "classic innovation" means. I think you mean something like "innovation in red ocean markets , but it's not really clear. And Blue Ocean and Red Ocean are theoretical concepts that need referencing...

In the attachment to this email you can find his CV with phone number and email address, so you can contact him in case you think it will be a good match.

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay

Once again thanks for your help!

See you around in the hotel!



Kind regards

Nikolay
